clv:ComponentDefinition.clv:Title: CAN Network
clv:ComponentDefinition.clv:Desc: Models a network for Controller Area Network (CAN) protocol.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Nodes to generate
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: List of nodes to generate C-code for.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Generate files full name
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: If set to "True" always uses full name for CAN generated C-code. Full name includes network and node name in the file in most of the cases. If set to "False" automatically determine if full names are required (generating more than one node in a given network or multiple networks) or not.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Prefix for data types enumerated symbols
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Prefix for data types enumerated symbols. Use $ to indicate an empty string. Use ${NWID} to indicate the network ID.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Prefix for type names of signal enumerations
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Prefix for type names of signal enumerations. Leave empty to name the generated types exactly as the source data_type. Use ${DATATYPE} to indicate the Data_Type name.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Msg search algorithms
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Type of search algorithms to implement for processing RX can messages.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Msg search algorithm
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Type of search algorithms to use for processing RX can messages.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Msg search algorithm - Parameter 1
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Parameter 1 of the selected search algorithm.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Msg search algorithm - Parameter 2
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Parameter 2 of the selected search algorithm.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Determine initial value for timeout flags.
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: If set to true timeout flags of rx CAN messages will be initialized as true. If set to false, timeout flags will be initialized as false.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Period of TX task
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Period of TX task for transmission of spontaneous messages.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Tolerance for TX period
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Tolerance in percentage to deviate from TX message period before throwing a warning message.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Period of RX task
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Period of task for processing RX messages timeouts.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Tolerance for RX timeout
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Tolerance in percentage to deviate from RX message timeouts before throwing a warning message.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Length of queue for TX messages
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Length of queue of messages waiting for transmission.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Time in ms of TX queue task
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Time in ms of TX queue task.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: TX confirm mesage ID
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: If True, TX confirmation will check for transmitted ID.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: TX Data initial value
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: TX Data initial value.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: RX Data initial value
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: RX Data initial value.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Protect direct access to data buffers
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: If set to True, the functions for reading and writing signals will be done in critical sections. If set to False, no critical sections will be used.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Generate all network with no overlaping between nodes and groups.
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: Generate all network with no overlaping between nodes and groups.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Write signal intializations
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: If set to True, signals will be initialized as specified in the CAN network. If set to False signals won't be individually initilized. They will all have the value in parameters CAN_rx_data_init_val and CAN_tx_data_init_val.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Optimize signal intializations
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: If set to True, code for initializing signals with init value equal to the one in parameter CAN_rx_data_init_val won't be generated. If set to False code will be generated as long as the signal has any valid defined init value.

clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Title: Write signal fail-safe values
clv:ParamDefinition.clv:Desc: If set to True, signals will get the specified fail-safe value upon timeout. If set to False, no change in signals data will be made upon timeout.
